p: We counted pollen on slides in the laboratory at the State University of New York at Old Westbury using light microscopy. All conspecific and Salix pollen grains under the coverslip were counted for each specimen. We computed a nonparametric (Spearman's) correlation between average seeds per flower and Salix contamination (SAS Proc CORR; 2013). Spearman's correlation was used because data did not fit assumptions of parametric statistics due to heteroscedacity, and transformation did not resolve the problem.
